result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Rosnostik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $426.77 to Walmart, $2656.58 to Target.  Minimum amount to be paid is $60.00 per month.
GFE to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or schooling.

Absolute sobriety. 

No contact with Target (Weston), Pick n Save (Rivers Edge) and Walmart (Rib Mountain).

Counseling.  Corrective Thinking. 

Comply with Department of Social Services Orders.  

DNA sample. 

Letters of apology to Target (Weston), Pick n Save (Rivers Edge) and Walmart (Rib Mountain).  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Any outstanding court costs to be paid as condition of probation NOT converted to civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 2:30pm
State appears by ADA Raymond Pelrine; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Pauline Toulouse.

Parties state recommendation for sentencing.
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Deft to serve 188 days MCJ, deft granted credit for 188 days served. Any outstanding court costs (CC, DNA surcharge, and victim witness surcharges) to be paid as condition of probation NOT converted into civil judgment. 

Adj: 2:33pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 9, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Rosnostik
Current: 414 Locust St, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: 1228 Prospect Ave, Wausau, WI 54403

Case Called: 10:18am. INCLUDES 13CM1508, 15CF143, 15CF167, 15CF200, 15CM157, 15CM158. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Amanda Ley. State indicates that Mtn to Revoke was heard on 3/13/15 and moves to enter Judgment.  Atty Ley in agreement. COURT enters Judgment on ct 1 (misd retail theft) 13CM1508. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (misd bj) 15CF167- crt grants. State moves to DRI cts 3 (felony retail theft) & cts 4 & 5 (misd bj) 15CF143- crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 1 (misd retail theft) & ct 3 (misd bj) 15CM158- crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 2 (misd bj) 15CF157 - crt grants.  State moves to DRI cts 2 - 8 in 15CF200- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (misd retail theft) 13CM1508; ct 1 (felony retail theft) 15CF167; ct 1 (felony retail theft) 15CF143; ct 2 (misd bj) 15CM158; ct 1 (misd retail theft) 15CM157; ct 1 (poss narcotic/party to) 15CF200. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State, Defense & Defendant. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 5 yrs probation on felonies in 15CF167;15CF143 & 15CF200; 2 yrs probation on misd charges in 13CM1508, 15CM157 &  15CM158, concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: Impose 1 yr jail on ct 1 (felony retail theft) 15CF167; Stay 9 months for rule violations; Defendant to serve 3 months MCJ w/huber if eligible pursuant to jail criteria; work or treatment; credit 77 days; Counseling; Corrective Thinking; AODA; Absolute Sobriety; Comply with Department of Social Services Orders; No contact and ltrs of apology to the following: Target (Weston); Pic N Save (Rivers Edge) & Walmart (Rib Mtn); Restitution - $426.77 to Walmart; $2,656.58 to Target; minimum amount to be paid at $60.00 per month; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; DNA Sample; DNA Surcharge on each file; Court Costs. No objection to transfer probation to Sauk County or appropriate County. COURT signs Restitution Order. Adjourned: 10:48am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:44 pm 
INCLUDES 13CM1508, 15CF143, 15CF167, 15CF200, 15CM157, AND 15CM158. 
State appears by ADAs Lisa Gramer and Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Amanda Ley. 
State gives history of matter - notes date and time was set for sentencing in 13CM1508 and bond modification in 15CF200. 
Parties note motion to revoke DEOJ in 13CM1508. 
Atty Ley makes statement and requests to proceed with sentencing and bond modification as scheduled. State makes statement - objects to bond modification. 

BOND MODIFICATION IN 15CF200. 
Argument re: bond. 
COURT makes findings. COURT denies motion for bond modification. 

COURT does not address sentencing in 13CM1508 today. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 3:58 pm
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

INCLUDES 15CM157 & 15CM158   No contact with victim(s): Pick N Save in Wausau & Walmart in Rib Mountain. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
